actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend the Military Personnel and Civilian Employees' Claims Act of 1964 to increase from $15,000 to $25,000 the maximum amount that the United States may pay to a member of the Armed Forces or to an officer or employee of the United States in settlement of a claim by such member or such officer or employee for losses incident to service as a member of the Armed Forces or an officer or employee of the United States and to eliminate such maximum in certain circumstances.

summary.text: Amends the Military Personnel and Civilian Employees Claims Act of 1964 to increase the amount payable under such Act to a member of the armed forces or to an officer or employee of the United States in settlement of a claim by such an individual for losses incident to service in such capacity. Removes such ceiling for claims by such individuals for personal property losses incident to an evacuation from a foreign country by order of the Secretary of State.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Military Personnel and Civilian Employees' Claims Act of 1964 to increase from $15,000 to $25,000 the maximum amount that the United States may pay to a member of the Armed Forces or to an officer or employee of the United States in settlement of a claim by such member or such officer or employee for losses incident to service as a member of the Armed Forces or an officer or employee of the United States and to eliminate such maximum in certain circumstances.
